thread.title: Morocco steps up security in wake of Tunisia attack
thread.title_full: Morocco steps up security in wake of Tunisia attack

title: Morocco steps up security in wake of Tunisia attack
text:
Morocco steps up security in wake of Tunisia attack 16 July 2015 
The Times 
reported that there was an anti-terror raid on an Isis cell ten-days ago. 
“No organised networks can develop here in Morocco because we dismantle them before they can get anywhere,” Mustapha El Khalfi, the government’s official spokesperson, told the newspaper. 
“Last summer, authorities launched the Vigilance programme, which means we have posted many more military police at main tourist places and in front of airports,” he said. “It follows a comprehensive plan we have developed since 2004 of religious reform, security measures and fighting extremist ideas.” 
Tourism accounts for 9% of Morocco’s GDP and more than half a million Britons visit the country every year. 
Last month’s attack on a beach in Tunisia killed 38 people, 30 of whom were British holidaymakers.
